# Task

You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.



# Data

q_and_a_extractor("# Question
What is the capital of France?

# Answer
The capital of France is Paris.
")

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::AbstractString)
    questions = findall(r"^# Question\s*$", md)
    answers = findall(r"^# Answer\s*$", md)
    if length(questions) == 0 || length(answers) == 0
        return ("No questions found", "No answers found")
    end

    question_start = first(questions) + 1
    answer_start = first(answers) - 1
    question = strip(md[question_start:answers[1]])
    answer = strip(md[answer_start:answers[2]])

    return (question, answer)
end
```

This function assumes that there is exactly one `# Question` and one `# Answer` section in the markdown text. If more than one set of questions and answers are present, it will only extract the first pair. The function also handles the case where no questions or answers are found by returning a tuple with placeholder strings.
